Class UnionFind

java.lang.Object
game.core.UnionFind
public class UnionFind extends Object
A Union-Find (Disjoint Set Union) data structure implementation. This class efficiently manages a collection of disjoint sets and supports union and find operations with path compression and union by rank optimizations.

This implementation is commonly used for connectivity problems, such as determining whether stones on a game board are connected.

Time Complexity:

  • Find: O(α(n)) amortized, where α is the inverse Ackermann function
  • Union: O(α(n)) amortized
  • Connected: O(α(n)) amortized

  • Field Details

    • parent

      private int[] parent
      Array where parent[i] represents the parent of element i. If parent[i] == i, then i is a root of its set.

    • rank

      private int[] rank
      Array where rank[i] represents an upper bound on the height of the tree rooted at i. Used for union by rank optimization.

  • Constructor Details

    • UnionFind

      public UnionFind(int size)
      Constructs a Union-Find data structure with the specified number of elements. Initially, each element is in its own set.
      Parameters:
      size - the total number of elements (typically positions on a game board)
      Throws:
      NegativeArraySizeException - if size is negative

  • Method Details

    • find

      public int find(int x)
      Finds the root representative of the set containing the specified element. Uses path compression to flatten the tree structure, improving performance of future operations.
      Parameters:
      x - the element whose set representative is to be found
      Returns:
      the root representative of the set containing x

    • union

      public void union(int a, int b)
      Merges the sets containing the two specified elements. Uses union by rank to keep the tree shallow by attaching the shorter tree under the root of the taller tree.

      If the elements are already in the same set, no action is taken.

      Parameters:
      a - the first element
      b - the second element

    • connected

      public boolean connected(int a, int b)
      Determines whether two elements are in the same set.
      Parameters:
      a - the first element
      b - the second element
      Returns:
      true if a and b are in the same set, false otherwise

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the UnionFind structure to its initial state.

      All elements are disconnected and become their own parents. Ranks are reset to zero.

    • copy

      public UnionFind copy()
      Creates a fast, deep copy of this UnionFind structure. * @return a new UnionFind instance with identical parent and rank arrays

    • getParentArray

      public int[] getParentArray()
      Gets the parent array for undo/redo support.
      Returns:
      copy of the parent array

    • getRankArray

      public int[] getRankArray()
      Gets the rank array for undo/redo support.
      Returns:
      copy of the rank array

    • restore

      public void restore(int[] parentArray, int[] rankArray)
      Restores UnionFind state from arrays (for undo).
